intro: Phelipanche hajastanica, commonly known as the Caucasian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or cultivated areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
